author: David
text:
The ordering process was smooth and the shipping was quick. The response time was excellent. That's where the positive ended for me. 

I ordered a beautiful Charvet white silk pocket square that was described as being in "pristine condition", their highest ranking. I received it and was quite surprised to notice there was an obvious glue stain in one corner from a sticker (which was only marginally improved by hand-washing and by using rubbing alcohol), a small 2mm hole in the fabric, 2 loose loops in the thread on the rolled edges, as well as 3 loose filaments of silk pulled from the fabric. None of these defects were mentioned in the description.

When I reached out to the company to sort out this situation, I was offered to return the item, but they would not reimburse at all the original shipping fees (they charged me >40$ here in Canada), and the return fees would only be offered as store credits. I would end up loosing a lot of money from the shipping fees and only get the back returned article's value. It would be acceptable if I had decided I no longer wanted the item, but given that this was the seller mistake in the first place, this was an unacceptable resolution. 

If I refused to return the item (and waste the shipping fees money), all they were willing to offer was 25$ of store credits. If they had offered 25$ money-back, that would have been slightly more acceptable, but offering store credits when it's their own mistake is crass at best. Not the kind of business-model you would expect from an average retailler, let alone a premium one.
title: Bad return policy even when they are at fault.

author: Nick
text: I bought some pants from them. I thought when they said in the website that items have minor wear, they meant some discoloration, fading, and other kinds. I didn't know it also meant that there are holes in the garments. I couldn't use 3 out of the 4 I purchased because the holes were in unsightly places and couldn't be remedied by just trimming the hem. I guess I'll be careful next time I buy from them.

author: Barbara
text: I recently purchased a dress from a brand that I regularly buy-- so I am familiar with the sizing.  When I received it, it seemed very small.  A check of the interior revealed that it had been altered.  I liked the garment and was able to deconstruct it and put it back together, but that was disappointing.  I don't know what kind of precautions could be taken to avoid that.
title: Watch out for alterations

author: customer
text: Buyer beware. Had variable success with TRR, just be willing to accept there is a good likelihood of something going wrong -condition inaccurately described, goods arrive with damage, customer service is poor. If shopping internationally take this into consideration as their mistakes will be at your cost and be prepared to receive absolutely no resolution or even a response.
